channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16792] Reuse KeyValue.KeyOnlyKeyValue in BufferedDataBlockEncoder.SeekerState
item.description: When every SeekerState#invalidate will new a fresh KeyValue.KeyOnlyKeyValue, we should reuse it.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: LGTM ramkrishna.s.vasudevan ?

-1 overall

+1. LGTM. Shall commit this code to master.
Pushed to master. Thanks for the patch binlijin. Thanks for the review Stack.

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1777 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1777/)
HBASE-16792 Reuse KeyValue.KeyOnlyKeyValue in (ramkrishna: rev f11aa4542f8f5489823fb72d1e9bc98e5cc6d742)

  • (edit) hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/KeyValue.java
  • (edit) hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/io/encoding/BufferedDataBlockEncoder.java

I think this checkin causes test failures. The QA shows green. May be QA did not run the needed tests. Reopening.
binlijin - Ping.
BufferedDataBlockEncoder#copyFromNext copies the currentKey reference from the next state, so SeekerState#invalidate may clear the current data.
I was having same doubt.. Wanted to check it today. Just noticed now only that it got committed. We need to close the issue as wont fix. We can not avoid the new object creation I believe.

With the HBASE-16792_master_v2.patch, mvn clean test -Dtest=org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.encoding.* all passed.
Is there other UT failed?
Thanks very much.
Thanks very much.
Anoop Sam John What about the HBASE-16792_master_v2.patch?

FAILURE: Integrated in Jenkins build HBase-Trunk_matrix #1778 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-Trunk_matrix/1778/)
revert HBASE-16792 due to test failures (ramkrishna: rev 193e0d60246441a00ef96a3f4b92b7cfd3b4cb1f)

  • (edit) hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/io/encoding/BufferedDataBlockEncoder.java
  • (edit) hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/KeyValue.java

Sorry about this. Could not check the reason for the failure. When i verified i found that every where only the previous state was invalidated. I missed this case. Will verify the fix and get back. Sorry all.
TestSeekTo,TestBlocksScanned and TestStoreFileScannerWithTagCompression were failing.
Seems like this trick will work out. QA might not be picking all the tests. It wont take tests from modules which are untouched by patch. We need to run all tests manually once.
HBASE-16792_master_v3.patch should make the QA picking the tests in hbase-server module.
I think the latest patch will work out. copyFromNext() was being done and when we invalidate that current key in moveToPRevious this problem happens I belive.
Thanks for checking this.

This message was automatically generated.

I verified the code and the reason for failure of the V1 patch. Actually the failures were due to test case the way it operates. We were seeking for a key and direcly calling getCell. In actual case it does not happen. Since we had invalidated the byte[] itself both previous and current were sharing that byte[]. So when we did getCell it failed. May be in actual case it does not happen.
So it is better to go with V2 patch only. +1 for V2/V3.
Will commit unless objections.

I checked QA. This time the failed tests have passed. Committed to master once again. Thanks binlijin.
And thanks all for the reviews.

Please correct the commit message - JIRA number:

iHBASE-16792 Reuse KeyValue.KeyOnlyKeyValue in
BufferedDataBlockEncoder.SeekerState (Binlijin)
Oh. Thanks Ted. Is there any way to edit the message instead of reverting and again recommitting?
No I guess. U have to revert and commit again with correct message.. This is what used to see in HBase.

* HBASE-16792 Reuse KeyValue.KeyOnlyKeyValue in

BufferedDataBlockEncoder.SeekerState (Binlijin)

Pushed again changing the commit message. I still don't know how that 'i' came at the beginning. First time I am seeing this happening.
